ngiemboon: Á la gwɔ́ púʼu, epʉ̀a metsèm pú ńcúʼte jʉʼ gie á laa mvfò ncwò nkáʼ gẅie lezíŋ laa lê ncwò nkáʼ mentse. Epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ gɔɔn mbwó Esendelásè nùŋepwɔʼ, ńgwɔ́ nkyàgte lepʉ̌ Ssé ngie à lɔgɔ ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌ Mǒonsê ńtó, é lepʉ̌ sie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la záb ńtí pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ.
en: all the people gathered together   at the square in front of the Water Gate.  # 8:1 Neh 3:26; 8:16 They asked the scribe Ezra  # 8:1 Ezr 7:6,11–12; Neh 8:9,13 to bring the book of the law of Moses  # 8:1 2Ch 34:14; Neh 8:7–9,13–14,18 that the Lord had given Israel.

ngiemboon: Esendelásè nùŋepwɔʼ lɔg lepʉ̌ ŋwɛ́ ńtóo mvfò pʉ̀a metsèm: é mbàŋa pâ panzwě ńgÿo pʉ̀a metsèm pie é la kuʼu léjúʼu mmó gie mé la ne ńtóŋo. Á laa na ndùŋmvfò lyɛ̌ʼ na saŋ sɔɔnmbʉ́a.
en: On the first day of the seventh month,   the priest Ezra  # 8:2 Ezr 7:1–5 brought the law  # 8:2 Neh 8:7,18 before the assembly of men, women, and all who could listen with understanding.

ngiemboon: À la zye létóŋ sɔɔn lepuʼú ŋwàʼne tà fó mbaʼámbaʼ, ńkú tsɛ̀ɛ zsǒ, á na jʉʼ gie áa mvfò ncwò nkáʼ gẅie lezíŋ ée lê ncwò nkáʼ mentse. Á laa púʼu mbàŋa pâ panzwě ńgÿo pʉ̀a metsèm pie é la ne ńjúʼu gwɔ́ ssé. Epʉ̀a la lɔgɔ kwɔ̀gɔnnɛ́ ńzẅíʼte páʼ mé tóŋo ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌.
en: While he was facing the square in front of the Water Gate,   he read out of it from daybreak until noon before the men, the women, and those who could understand. All the people listened attentively  # 8:3 Lit The ears of all the people listened to the book of the law.  # 8:3 Dt 28:61; 2Ch 17:9; 25:4; 34:14–15

ngiemboon: Esendelásè gẅie à laa nkyàgte lepʉ̌ Ssé la tyé ndùm lʉ̀ʼ gie mé la lɔgɔ peláŋ ńnyɛte, ńtí pɔ́ nò ayɛ̌. Epʉ̀a pie é la tyé na gwoŋó pwó yé yetʉ̀ laa Matitiya, Shÿema, Anaya, Ulia, Hikiya pɔ́ Maseya, á piŋ ńgwɔ́ na gwoŋó pwó yé ye kyɛ̀bɛ, ńgwɔ́ Pendaya, Mishÿayɛ, Malekiya, Aashum, Ashÿembandanaa, Sakalîɛ ńgÿo Meshulam.
en: The scribe Ezra stood on a high wooden platform   made for this purpose. Mattithiah, Shema, Anaiah, Uriah, Hilkiah, and Maaseiah stood beside him on his right; to his left were Pedaiah, Mishael, Malchijah, Hashum, Hash-baddanah, Zechariah, and Meshullam.

ngiemboon: Esendelásè la nyɛ́ʼɛ ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌ tà láʼ ntsèm pú ńgyá; ńtí nue à la tyé ndùmo kwóŋ, aláʼ gwɔ́ tsíŋe ssé; à la gwɔ́ tà ńnyɛ́ʼɛ ŋwàʼne, epʉ̀a metsèm pú ńdu ssé ńtyé tyé.
en: Ezra opened the book in full view of all the people, since he was elevated above everyone. As he opened it, all the people stood up.

ngiemboon: Esendelásè síe Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gie e fǎŋ, anùɔ láʼ gwɔ́ pÿɛ, ńkwéʼe mbwó mɔ́b, ńnáa tÿǒ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu! Oon, á gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu!» Ńzẅíŋ púʼu, ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tà zǐ yɔ́b kíbe ssé.
en: Ezra blessed the Lord, the great God, and with their hands uplifted   all the people said, “Amen, Amen! ”  # 8:6 Neh 5:13 Then they knelt low and worshiped the Lord with their faces to the ground.  # 8:6 2Ch 20:18

ngiemboon: Yǒonshûa, Mbani, Shÿelembia, Yamɛŋ, Akub, Shÿatayii, Ondiya, Maseya, Kelita, Azaliya, Yozambad, Anaŋ, Pelaya pâ pʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀te Lěvî la ne ńkyagte lepʉ̌ mbwó láʼ, á laa púʼu aláʼ tyé tyě.
en: Jeshua, Bani, Sherebiah, Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodiah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, Jozabad, Hanan, and Pelaiah,   who were Levites,  # 8:7 Vg, 1 Esdras 9:48; MT reads Pelaiah and the Levites,# 8:7 Ezr 8:15,18–19; Neh 7:43 explained the law  # 8:7 Lv 10:11; Mal 2:6,8 to the people as they stood in their places.

ngiemboon: À la ne ńtóŋo ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌ Ssé na ntí gie mé ge júʼ, ḿbiŋe ne ńkyagte na ntí gie mé ge cwoŋo júʼu mmó gie à tǒŋ.
en: They read out of the book of the law of God, translating and giving the meaning so that the people could understand what was read.

ngiemboon: Ngúmnɔ̀ɔn Neyemi, Esendelásè gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ, ńgwɔ́ nkyàgte lepʉ̌ Ssé, pâ ngẅɛ̀te Lěvî pie é lɔ́ɔn ńzíʼi pʉ̀a mmó gɔɔn mbwó láʼ ntsèm ngie: «Alyɛʼɛ́ láʼ yɔɔn áa ndʉalʉ̌a mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi! Tà pi nuŋe legwé ńdʉa! À lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn púʼu mélàʼmie aláʼa ntsèm la ne ńdʉa fʉ̀ʼ gie mé la ne ńtóŋo lepʉ̌ Ssé.»
en: Nehemiah the governor,   Ezra the priest and scribe,  # 8:9 Ezr 7:1–6 and the Levites who were instructing the people said to all of them, “This day  # 8:9 Nm 29:1–6 is holy to the Lord your God. Do not mourn or weep.”  # 8:9 Ezr 3:12–13; 10:1,6 For all the people were weeping as they heard the words of the law.

ngiemboon: Esendelásè gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi gʉa ḿpfɛ́ɛ jʉʼʉ mbab mbòŋo, ńnú melùʼ mie é pʉ́le, ḿbiŋ ńnáa ye pʉ̀a pie é té gẅiin mmó gie pɔ́ ge pfɛ́ fʉʼó wɔ́; á nue yɔɔn lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ áa ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege. Tà pi mÿɔg! Á nue lekág Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔɔ mí metʉ̀.»
en: Then he said to them, “Go and eat what is rich, drink what is sweet, and send portions to those who have nothing prepared,   since today  # 8:10 Nm 29:1–6 is holy to our Lord. Do not grieve, because the joy of the Lord is your strength.”  # 8:10 Or stronghold,# 8:10 Dt 16:11,14–15

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀ Lěvî la ne sẅéte ntʉ́m láʼ ntsèm ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pi láŋte! Á nue lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ yɔɔn áa ndʉalʉ̌a, tà pi gíŋe ḿmÿɔg!»
en: And the Levites quieted all the people, saying, “Be still,   since today  # 8:11 Nm 29:1–6 is holy. Don’t grieve.”

ngiemboon: Aláʼ ntsèm la gʉa lépfɛ́, ḿbiŋ ńnú, pɔ́ la gabte shúm léjÿó sɔ́b, ńná se pʉ̀a pie é la te tsɔ́ mmó cwoŋte, ńdeen ńké ńzye lépú ńkág. Á nue pɔ́ la júʼ meshwóŋè mie mé kyagte shwóŋo wɔ́b.
en: Then all the people began to eat and drink, send portions, and have a great celebration,   because they had understood the words that were explained to them.

ngiemboon: Á laa na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a, mefùɔ metsìŋendá pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ láʼ ntsèm, panuŋepwɔʼ mbɔɔ ngẅɛ̀te Lěvî, é cúʼte lejʉ́ŋ Esendelásè gẅie aa nkyàgte lepʉ̌ Ssé, lécwoŋo ńjúʼu nò na lepʉ̌ Ssé.
en: On the second day, the family heads of all the people, along with the priests and Levites,   assembled before the scribe Ezra  # 8:13 Ezr 7:6; Neh 8:1,9 to study the words of the law.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gyá mbà mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ lepʉ̌ ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la cʉate na Mǒonsê, ńzáb ngie epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ gẅiin lénéŋe pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mentàb, á fʉ̀ʼ gie mé ne ńjÿó línɔ̀ɔn ná saŋ mbɔ́ɔntè Sɔɔnmbʉ́a.
en: They found written in the law how the Lord had commanded through Moses that the Israelites should dwell in shelters during the festival of the seventh month.

ngiemboon: Á la piŋ ne ńzɛ́te ngie pɔ́ sáʼ wɔɔn nkʉ̀ línɔ̀ɔn tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ mɔ́b, mbɔɔ Yelúzálèm, ńgɔɔn ngie: Aláʼ gʉa lekwɛ́, ńzáʼ mbwó metÿǒ mevɛ́ olive, ńzáʼ mbwó metÿǒ mevɛ́ olive we mbàʼ mbɔɔ mbwó metÿǒ mie mé tóŋo lê míitè, mbɔɔ meyáŋa letÿǒon lâ mbwó metÿǒ mie é fúʼte fuʼté, ńdɔg ńtó mé lɔg ńjwóŋ mentàb ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ mé la ŋweʼe.
en: So they proclaimed and spread this news throughout their towns and in Jerusalem, saying, “Go out to the hill country and bring back branches of olive, wild olive, myrtle, palm, and other leafy trees to make shelters, just as it is written.”

ngiemboon: Á la gwɔ́ púʼu, aláʼ leen ńké ńkẅɛ, ńgwá faʼ mbwó metÿǒ amɛ̌. Pɔ́ la jwóŋ mentàb, petsɔ́ pʉ̀a jwóŋ mɔ́b ntsɔ̀ʼ ndá pɔ́b, petsɔ́ jwóŋ mɔ́b tetʉ́a pɔ́b, petsɔ́ jwóŋ mɔ́b tetʉ́a ndá Ssé, petsɔ́ jwóŋ mɔ́b jʉʼ gie á laa mvfò ncwò nkáʼ gẅie lezíŋ ée lê ncwò nkáʼ mentse mbɔɔ na jʉʼ gie á laa ncwò nkáʼ gẅie lezíŋ ée lê ncwò nkáʼ Efalayîm.
en: The people went out, brought back branches, and made shelters for themselves on each of their rooftops   and courtyards, the court of the house of God, the square by the Water Gate,  # 8:16 Neh 3:26; 8:1; 12:37 and the square by the Ephraim Gate.  # 8:16 2Ch 25:23

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a metsèm pie é la fó ndá nkwɔɔn ḿbiŋ nzèm, é la pú ńjwóŋ mentàb, ḿbiŋe ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńtsẅé pɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ mentàb amɛ̌. Tà fó fʉ̀ʼʉ Yǒonshûa gẅie aa míŋ Nûn, ńgʉa ńkú lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ laa gíŋe ńgÿo tsɔ́ línɔ̀ɔn páʼ yɛ̌ wɔ́. À laa máamáa lekág.
en: The whole community that had returned from exile   made shelters and lived in them. The Israelites had not celebrated like this from the days of Joshua son of Nun until that day.  # 8:17 2Ch 7:9; Ezr 3:4 And there was tremendous joy.  # 8:17 2Ch 30:21

ngiemboon: Mé lɔ́ɔn ńtóŋo ŋwàʼne lepʉ̌ Ssé pɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ ntsèm tà fó ndùŋmvfò lyɛ̌ʼ, ńgʉa ńkúu nzsònzèm lyɛ̌ʼ. Mé la jÿó línɔ̀ɔn lyɛ̌ʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin lyɛʼɛ́ línɔ̀ɔn yelÿò á na mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛ̌ʼ lefɔ̌ɔn na páʼ lepʉ̌ la ne ńzɛ́te.
en: Ezra   read out of the book of the law of God  # 8:18 Neh 8:1,3 every day, from the first day to the last. The Israelites celebrated the festival for seven days, and on the eighth day there was a solemn assembly, according to the ordinance.  # 8:18 Lv 23:34–36
